subject: Career
title: The Art of Saying No
description: A 60-second lesson on The Art of Saying No.

hook.text: Every 'yes' to something unimportant is a 'no' to something that matters. But saying no feels career-threatening.

buildup.text: People-pleasers say yes by default. High performers say no by default â€” then selectively say yes.

discovery.text: Greg McKeown's 'Essentialism': if it's not a clear yes, it's a no. This filter protects your most valuable resource â€”.

twist.text: Saying no to your boss feels impossible. But framing it as prioritization â€” 'Which should I drop?' â€” works.

climax.text: Practice: 'I can't take this on right now, but here's when I could.' Offer alternatives, not just refusals.

punchline.text: Saying no to the trivial is saying yes to what matters.

quiz.question: What is the Essentialism filter for decisions?
options: If it's not a clear yes, it's a no
